title: I paid for overnight shipping
text: I paid for overnight shipping, here we are the next day and the item has not even shipped.I think the fix could be to show a cut-off time to determine if you want to pay for overnight shipping and not actually get overnight shipping.Even show when the item will be delivered according to your order.

title: Whatever it’s fine
text: Whatever it’s fine. I could do without the “you will be sent to collections” emails two months before my renewal was due as I was waiting for a court decision on closing the estate for which I needed the bond. Super fun to get shaken down after the death of my mother. They also refused to ship the bond via any shipping service other than FedEx even after I expressed concern that FedEx routinely delivers to wrong businesses in my area. It was of course delivered to the wrong address and they wanted to charge me a second time to send it with FedEx. Just stop using FedEx they are expensive and unreliable. But anyway you to can do the whole process online which was good for me because I had to probate an estate in a state where I don’t reside and this saved me a trip. Get a bond from them or don’t it probably will not change your life in any meaningful way.

title: The service leading to acquisition of…
text: The service leading to acquisition of the bond was efficient. However, once the bond was submitted to Florida Athletic Commission, it was rejected because the bond was submitted on an outdated form with former name of Florida State Boxing Commission. This created a bit of panic due to promoter’s license being under a temporary hold until situation was rectified with correct form that the commission forwarded to me. I then had to forward the updated form to SuretyBond.com to redo the bond.

title: Alright then,
text: Alright then,3 months before my bond was up for renewal I received an email which included a warning that if not paid it would be sent to collections?! As executor of a very complex estate in probate I'm very aware of the anniversary and that the bond must be renewed, I'm living it!The probate court system demands a paper trail.I'll mention that it was convenient being able to pay the bond renewal fee with a check, as many probate executors past and present could confirm

title: Customer service issues
text: Where I appreciate the fact that they gave me a surety bond, I applied for too surety bonds in the same day. Unfortunately, they didn't notify me in any way shape or form that they could not fulfill the second surety bond until I called in asking about it. I waited for over 3 hours for a response from them, and I had to call in to get it! I think if there's a reason why you're not going to take and give the surety bond that you should take the initiative to get a hold of the customer and explain to them why you are not going to do it. Also, if you're not doing surety bonds for yourself, and multiples of them, make sure that every single one has a different person's name, email address, and phone number!

title: We placed an order for my wife and my…
text: We placed an order for my wife and my bond on the same phone call. My bond came back with no errors, my wife's bond came back with an s at the end of our last name.We called and spoke to another reprecetative, who was able to correct my wifes spelling on our last name, and fixed our address. Somehow we missed the fact our address was wrong as the UPS driver knows my wife and I due to our business on the street.That is why I gave the company a 3 star rating.

title: Calls too much- emails too
text: The renewal process is easy and prices are fair. This company will, however harass you for months prior to when your renewal is due. I asked them to stop and they didn’t. Now, after having left them a 3 star review they are calling me MORE. If this doesn’t annoy you then this company is fine. I have no other issues with their service

title: I don't even know if 3 stars is too…

Sadly, most companies suck at service and support so a 3 is about average I guess. When I went to renew I changed slightly my plan name and it said I had to wait for them to review it, then I emailed and after about 3 emails they finally went in and set it up so I could renew. The problem was clearly they didn't read my emails to them until the 3rd time. I'll probably move my insurances for a few plans to other providers moving forward.

title: Overall our experience was fine

title: It was easy to apply and their response…
text: It was easy to apply and their response was quick.  Very competitively priced. The only problem was my email didn't contain my name so they went with one of my partners emails. When I responded back to the emails asking for additional information, I never got a response back.When I did purchase my bond, they completed my address incorrectly, but did correct it in an acceptable time frame.

title: Process was super simple, but no original document yet

All I needed was to email my documents to Levi and then in the next couple of hours he had everything set up.One thing I didn't know is that they only provide you with a digital copy with a massive watermark on it. The only way to get your original document is to pay $10 for shipping. It's been about 3 weeks and I'm still waiting for my document.

title: My honest experience
text: My honest experience. I went online to purchase a surety bond. Surety bond.com was easy and ready to go. Now I've received a survey to fill out but no bond or bond info to follow. Maybe hthere should be a survey after the bond has gone through. Not just after they've taken my money. Heres to hoping I actually receive a bond after this.

title: My certificate did not come to my email…
text: My certificate did not come to my email until hours after I submitted the application. That delayed our class submitting our app to the State of Illinois for processing by more than a day. This should have been an immediate transaction!

title: Too much baggage
text: Too much baggage! My renewal comes up in mid-December, and I started getting constant phone calls and emails as early as July to renew. The titles of the emails and the voicemails almost sounded threatening by the middle of November, sounding like my bond was on the verge of being canceled if I did not renew immediately. When I did renew, they had an outdated/ incorrect office suite number on one of the two places that my address was listed on the review form. When I corrected it, I had to go through a whole series of steps to justify why the situation was in review. Too much baggage for a service that I can get from thousands of other vendors.

title: Surety Bond (multiple corp)
text: I have a current bond for a motor vehicle dealership that originated with this company. Although the imformation given to me was that my state DMV would be notified of my bonding number each time its renewed; it wasnt and resulted in an audit. I had to prove my bond information as well as other paperwork on file which risked fines. The process by which I obtained the bond with this company was simple and therefore, I applied for my broker bomd which, too, was easy, but I still do not trust that the bond is reported correctly.

title: Not the best customer service!!!
text: My initial experience was good.  The Account Mgr I spoke with (Jared) answered my questions.  But whe I followed up with additional questions, he was unresponsive.  I called several times and there was no call back or even an apology for his inability to respond.  Even though I ended up purchasing the bond I don't know if I would recommend him to anybody else.  I literally had to call back 3 times to get someone to help me. Poor customer service is what kills businesses.  I hope you pass along my commentary. Thank you and have a wonderful day~ Richard

title: Latest call
text: I've called many times for bonds as we are a contractor and the service is fast and excellent. This time when I called I felt like the person was either new or did not know what to do.

title: Make sure you have good phone numbers
text: The initial agent that was assigned to our case never told my husband and me that he was going on vacation in 2 days. After giving him all the information, we told him we need the bond asap because we were leaving on vacation in a week. He said, no problem. A couple days past. No word. My husband tried calling the number listed on the assigned agent’s page but would not connect. Another day went by. Our stress level rising. We needed the bond before we left on vacation for court. Finally, my husband found another number from your company. An agent told us that the agent assigned to our case went on vacation and won’t be back for a week. We explained our situation and he got the bond for us in 1 day.  Our stress could have been avoided if the initial agent would have passed our claim to another agent or not answered the phone!

It is a different county than the one where I live. However, my resident county is what was printed on the bond. I contacted Customer Service via email, and I received a prompt response and a corrected bond, so I would rate the Customer Service part of the experience as Great.

title: Third time was a charm
text: I ordered a Surety Bond from SuretyBonds.com in connection with the application for a Missouri sales tax license. The application process was very smooth; however, the first Bond I received in the mail had the city stated incorrectly for our business.  I brought this error to their attention and they resent the bond.  The second one I received has our Federal Tax ID number truncated, so I called them and asked for another bond.  Finally, the third time was charm and it was correct. I opted on the first order for a FedEx two-day delivery and based on all of this back and forth I believe they should have credited me for that fee.  They did not, however. The excuses I got for the issues were that the lady I was dealing with submitted the bond but was not responsible for reviewing it before it was sent out. I think they should change their process and add a QA function.

title: I paid the extra money to have the bond…
text: I paid the extra money to have the bond overnighted and surety bonds sent the shipping company the wrong address.  I confirmed I gave them the right one with Bob Wolf but the shipping co Fedex received the wrong address!  Money wasted!!!!  My application was delayed. and I am sure I will never get that money back.  Very disappointing.  Everything else was fine. so I give a three star rating if the shipping could of been done right I would of given an excellent review. Surety bonds never even said we apologize of checked on anything for me, Bob simply sent a tracking number and then I was on my own.  I would not treat customers like that!I am surprised and pleasantly I might add.  Mr. Brad Bullerdieck read my review and took care of it.  Mr Bullerdieck sent me a check repaying me for the overnight that never happened, apologized and acted in a very professional manner.  This guy is aces! I an very happy and look forward to many more years of service.  I will be sharing this story with other contractor friend of mine.  Thanks Brad, the check arrived yesterday via Fedex.  All the best to you and yours.RespectfullyRichard L. Winget
